results.title: How green was my valley
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Darryl F. Zanuck and John Ford
results.brief_description: Winner of five Academy Awards, this is an inspiring yet heart-breaking film from producer Darryl Zanuck and director John Ford. Sixty year old Huw Morgan looks back on his life as a boy (Roddy McDowall) in a small Welsh mining town. His reminiscences reveal the disintegration of the closely knit Morgans, and his devoted parents (Donald Crisp, Sara Allgood), while capturing the sentiments and issues of their time. Maureen O’Hara and Walter Pidgeon co-star in this acclaimed classic, the story of one family’s dreams, struggles and triumphs. Based on the famous novel by Richard Llewellyn. Includes performances by the Welsh Singers.

results.title: Housekeeping
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Robert F. Colesberry and Bill Forsyth
results.brief_description: Abandoned early in life, Ruth and Lucille have been raised by various relatives - now it’s Aunt Sylvie’s (Christine Lahti) turn. But Aunt Sylvie isn’t like their other relatives, she used to be a hobo and can’t seem to change her eccentric ways. She takes midday naps on park benches and wears an overcoat lined with old newspapers. Sylvie may be embarrassing, but she’s like a breath of fresh air to the two girls. Can Lucille and Ruth cope with Sylvie, and can Sylvie cope with the real responsibility of a family? This is a beautiful story of quirky relationships, loneliness, and the bonding of kindred spirits. Based on the book by Marilynne Robinson.

results.title: Houseboat
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Jack Rose and Melville Shavelson
results.brief_description: Poor little rich-girl ends up being the governess to a widower and his three children aboard an old houseboat. Sophia Loren and Cary Grant steam up the screen in this classic romantic comedy, complete with luscious colour and ‘VistaVision’ widescreen presentation from 1950s cinema. Resplendent in divine gowns designed by Edith Head, Sophia Loren learns about life and love with a few song and dance routines along the way. The three lead children are also delightful in this witty and entertaining film. Cast includes Martha Hyer and Harry Guardino. Winner of two Academy Awards for Best Song and Best Screenplay, written by Melville Shavelson and Jack Rose.

results.title: House on Haunted Hill
results.creator_credit: Allied Artists Pictures and William Castle
results.brief_description: Directed in 1958 by 50s B-grade horror maestro William Castle, “House on Haunted Hill” boasted the arrival of “Emergo”, a fluorescent skeleton that swept across the head of audience members in the cinema. Widowed playboy millionaire Frederick Loren (Vincent Price) invites 5 guests: a race driver, a columnist, the previous owner, a psychiatrist, and a typist to spend a night with Loren and his fourth wife, Annabelle, in the haunted house. At the strike of midnight the doors will close, the electricity will be out, and 12 hours lie ahead in a tenement in which there have been several mysterious deaths, including those of Loren’s previous 3 wives. The 4 men and 3 women have nothing in common, other than their need for money, and Loren has posted a reward of $10,000 for anyone who lasts the night. Low in budget, the film boasts several frightening scenes, including an acid bath and dismembered head, earning the film an M rating. Cast includes: Vincent Price, Richard Long, Alan Marshal, Carolyn Craig. Music composed and conducted by Castle collaborator Von Dexter. Remade in 1999 by William Malone.

results.title: House of wax
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Bryan Foy and Andre De Toth
results.brief_description: Professor Henry Jarrod is a renowned wax sculptor who is plunged into madness when an arsonist burns down his wax museum. Jarrod loses his life’s work and, having lost the ability to use his flame-scarred hands, comes up with a new way of stocking his reformed House of Wax in New York. Aided by his mute assistant (Charles Bronson), he dips his victims in wax! Cast includes Vincent Price, Frank Lovejoy, Phyllis Kirk and Carolyn Jones.

results.title: Hotel Sorrento
results.creator_credit: Bayside Pictures, Horizon (GB), Horizon Films (AU), Film Finance Corporation Australia, Film Victoria and Richard Franklin
results.brief_description: Hotel Sorrento is the story of three sisters who grew up in a small Australian coastal town. One is a successful writer living in London, another a businesswoman in New York, while the third remained at the family home after the death of her husband. When they are reunited after years apart, not only are fond family memories rekindled, but the unspoken feelings and unresolved tensions of past betrayal resurface. When tragedy strikes, they not only confront old wounds but discover that their lives will never be the same again. Starring Caroline Goodall, Caroline Gillmer, Tara Morice and Joan Plowright. Co-starring Ray Barrett, Nicholas Bell, Ben Thomas and John Hargreaves. Based on the stage play of the same name by Hannie Rayson.

results.title: Hotel de Love
results.creator_credit: Pratt Film Productions, Michael Lake, David Parker and Craig Rosenburg
results.brief_description: Teenagers, smooth-talking party animal, Rick (Aden Young) and his shy twin brother Stephen (Simon Bossell) fall for the same gorgeous uni student, Melissa (Saffron Burrows). Rick woos her and then loses her. A decade on and Rick is working as the manager of Hotel de Love, a tacky, neon-laced romantic hideaway, whilst Stephen has buried himself in the world of stockbroking. Life is dull and unchallenging until Melissa arrives at the hotel and the hijinks begin. Also starring Pippa Grandison, Ray Barrett and Julia Blake.

results.title: Hot lead and cold feet
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Ron Miller and Robert Butler
results.brief_description: A Walt Disney comedy about a pioneer who has founded the small town of Bloodshy. With the assistance of his twin sons, Eli discovers he must fight for control of the town’s future against the town’s corrupt mayor. With Jim Dale playing the three main roles this is essentially a family oriented adventure film set in the old Wild West, replete with gunslingers and outlaws. Cast also includes Karen Valentine, Don Knotts, Jack Elam and John Williams.

results.title: Horror Hotel
results.brief_description: Screenwriter George Baxt combines the “Psycho” gimmick of killing the apparent heroine at the beginning of the film with elements of the Salem witches story thrown in for added spine tingling suspense. Professor Driscoll (Christopher Lee) sends Nan (Venetia Stevenson), one of his students, to Whitewood, Massachusetts to research local legends of witchcraft. In the decaying village she is used as a human sacrifice by the witches coven. Nan’s boyfriend and brother go to look for her, and discover an entire village full of zombie-like creatures dressed in monastic habits. The finale is so full of intrigue that you must see this ghoulish epic for yourself.

details.label: Subject categories
display_values: Feature films → Feature films - United States

results.title: Horror express
results.creator_credit: JEF Films, Bernard Gordon and Eugenio Martin
results.brief_description: This hair-raiser is a classic Christopher Lee - Peter Cushing chiller guaranteed to give you goosebumps. It is a real blast of science fiction horror which has as its setting the Trans-Siberian Express. Set in 1906, Lee (an explorer) is returning from China with a mysterious crate containing what he believes are the remains of an apelike creature. This missing link is inhabited by an alien force which can assimilate all the knowledge from people simply by staring at them. The process boils their brains, kills the victims instantly, and makes their eyes bleed and turn white. Late the life force takes over the hapless passengers who appear normal, but are actually zombies possessed by the monsters personality. Lee and Cushing team up to defeat the creature. They saw the tops off the victims heads for brain inspections, only to be horrified by their inexplicable discoveries. The dead passengers, now an army of zombies, march through the train toward the petrified survivors.
